page.title: 01West of Staindrop
page.content: The area west of Staindrop village has a prominantly rural flavour. Farming in the form of grazing forestry and a little mixed farming contribute greatly to the areas economy. Off the Z roads transecting the area to Egglestone and Barnard Castle the latter is of most importance as Barnard Castle itself acts as the economic nucleus of the whole area known as 'Teesdale' behaving as a kind of Entrepot, being of greatest importance to the farming community. The colour and beauty of this areas undulating landscape broken by the occasional set of white farm buildings, which belong to the famous Lord Barnard's Raby Estate is often forgotten in a region of outstanding beauty.
